summary: The provided document is a table of unreported cases from the Supreme Court of Ghana for the year 2002. It lists various civil appeals, constitutional motions, and ex-parte applications heard by the court, including case names, case numbers, and hearing dates. Notable cases include Fijai Stool v. Effia Stool concerning chieftaincy disputes, and Tsatsu Tsikata v. The Chief Justice & Attorney General, which may involve constitutional or judicial review issues. The list also includes commercial disputes such as P.S. International Limited & Ors. v. Godka Group of Companies and NASIB Dahabieh v. S.A. Tarqui & Brothers. Several cases are ex-parte applications involving judicial review of lower court decisions, such as Republic v. High Court, Accra, ex-parte Ghana Commercial Bank Pensioners Association. The document serves as a case index rather than a full judgment, so detailed reasoning and outcomes are not available.
citations: FIJAI STOOL v. EFFIA STOOL [3/7/2002] CIVIL APPEAL NO. 14/2001
REPUBLIC v. COURT OF APPEAL EX-PARTE GHANA COMMERCIAL BANK PENSIONERS ASSOCIATION [29/05/2002] CM 10/2002
NASIB DAHABIEH v. S. A. TARQUI & BROTHERS [29/5/2002] CIVIL APPEAL NO. 8/2001
TSATSU TSIKATA v. CHIEF JUSTICE & ATTORNEY GENERAL [18/05/2002] WRIT NO. 6/2002
THE REPUBLIC v. HIGH COURT, ACCRA EX-PARTE: EXPENDABLE POLYSTYRENE PRODUCTS LIMITED [24/07/02] C.M. 21/2002
confidenceNotes: The source document is an index of cases and does not contain full judgments, so details on verdicts, reasoning, or judges are unavailable. Information is limited to case titles, numbers, and dates.
